Class Stone

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stone

  • public class Stone
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a stone for the board game Mancala. Each Stone is responsible for drawing itself using a Graphics2D object and uses a specific MancalaBoardLayout style to do so.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stone(MancalaBoardLayout appearance)
      Creates a Stone that uses the given MancalaBoardLayout.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.awt.Point p) 
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2, double x, double y)
      Draws this Stone at a specific x and y coordinates, with the given Graphics2D, and according to the Stone's MancalaBoardLayout
      double getHeight()
      Returns the height of this Stone
      double getWidth()
      Returns the width of this Stone

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stone

        public Stone(MancalaBoardLayout appearance)
        Creates a Stone that uses the given MancalaBoardLayout.
        Parameters:
        appearance - the MancalaBoardLayout that this Stone will use

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                 double x,
                 double y)
        Draws this Stone at a specific x and y coordinates, with the given Graphics2D, and according to the Stone's MancalaBoardLayout
        Parameters:
        g2 - the Graphics2D that will draw this Stone
        x - the x-coordinate for the Stone's top left corner
        y - the y-coordinate for the Stone's top left corner
